com.kamontat.utilities

Class ExecuteWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kamontat.utilities.ExecuteWorker

  • public class ExecuteWorker
extends Object
    Execute some very very slow code in some way, that make java code much more Asynchronous programming
    Meaning: if you want to run some code in background or want to wait until the code been finished.
    In this class I use ExecutorService to manage the task, I create 3 type of execution
    1. Schedule - to schedule execute action with delay until some ime
    2. execute(Callable) - To do some task in the background
    3. executeAndWaitAll(Runnable...) or executeAndWaitAny(Callable[]) - Exxecute some very task and want program to wait until the task was end
    Beware: To use the multiThread class, after you don't use the class anymore please call shutdown() or forceShutdown() to stop and terminal the thread

    Example: 

    
     // create new thread
     ExecuteWorker thread = new ExecuteWorker(Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(1));
     // print "Hello world!" in every 1 second for 1 minutes
     thread.schedule(() -> System.out.println("Hello world!"), 0, 1, 60, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
     // close the thread
     multiThread.shutdown();
    Since:
    Wed 15/Mar/2017 - 10:08 PM
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    kamontat
    See Also:
    ExecutorService, Executors, Future

      private class  ExecuteWorker.ScheduleException 
      class  ExecuteWorker.ScheduleFutureImp
      This class implemented because I need the easy way to manage the ScheduledFuture
      This class have new method call ExecuteWorker.ScheduleFutureImp.waitAndDone() so that program will wait until program done

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public ExecuteWorker.ScheduleFutureImp schedule(Runnable runnable,
                                                int initial,
                                                int delay,
                                                int until,
                                                TimeUnit unit,
                                                boolean fix)
        The service must be ScheduledExecutorService class
        the scheduling the task in time interval at the future,

        And because of ScheduledExecutorService don't have method that can rerun the task and end at some time so I need to implement by myself by using Future.cancel(boolean) method to cancel it when task should be end.
        Example:
        Parameters:
        runnable - method that want to execute
        initial - the time interval at first run runnable
        delay - the time interval
        until - the time end
        unit - unit if the time
        fix - true when the delay time meaning delay time will fixed (not whether execute time is what but program will add more delay time on it); otherwise is false
        1. if true you can learn more at ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleWithFixedDelay(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit)
        2. if false you can learn more at ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit)
        Returns:
        ScheduledFuture - this class will let you know what going on, since this method will close from cancellation only so you cannot use the method get() normally

      • execute

        public Future<?> execute(Runnable runnable)
                  throws RejectedExecutionException
        To execute method Runnable.run() in the background
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the object that represent future result, if you call Future.get() when task execute successfully, it's wil return null
        Throws:
        RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution
        NullPointerException - if runnable is null
        See Also:
        Future

      • isTerminate

        public boolean isTerminate()
        Inherit docs from ExecutorService.isTerminated()
        Returns true if all tasks have completed following shut down. Note that isTerminated is never true unless either shutdown or shutdownNow was called first.
        Returns:
        true, if already terminal; otherwise, return false
        See Also:
        ExecutorService.isTerminated()

      • forceShutdown

        public List<Runnable> forceShutdown()
        force shutdown and return the task that not execute successfully.
        Returns:
        list of all task that not finish yet!, or null if all task is done or already shutdown the service
        See Also:
        ExecutorService.shutdownNow()

      • wait

        public boolean wait(long time,
                    TimeUnit unit)
             throws InterruptedException
        Blocks until all tasks have completed.
        There are 3 ways that program can pass this method
        1. Shutdown - user already call shutdown() or forceShutdown() ~ result will be Boolean.TRUE
        2. Timeout - user the runnable/callable run/call exceed timeout interval ~ result will be Boolean.FALSE
        3. Exception - when have exception while running the program ~ result will be InterruptedException
        Parameters:
        time - the maximum time for waiting
        unit - the unit for waiting time
        Returns:
        true if successful terminate the thread, false if timeout
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - when error occurred while waiting
        See Also:
        ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, TimeUnit)

        public static void doBackground(Runnable run)
